intro: Vandellia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf vandellia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is often found in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
